explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: Documentation references the organization-wide deployment of an AI platform for "go/no-go" acquisition decisions, indicating a structured approach to AI-driven decision-making and automated planning for business outcomes. It also describes the deployment of a specific AI tool for a defined business process within the company.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. Transparency is supported by the detailed description of the AI-native platform's components (ZoneAI and SiteAI) and its specific functions in extracting zoning rules, environmental data, and parcel records. Governance is implied by the organization-wide deployment of the platform to generate "go/no-go" acquisition decisions, indicating a structured approach to AI-driven decision-making and automated planning for business outcomes.
relevant_sources.title: Prophetic to Power D.R. Horton's AI-Driven Land Acquisition at National Scale

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency by detailing the capabilities of Prophetic's AI, including its use of a large language model for automated zoning analysis and its ability to process zoning documents across multiple jurisdictions. The press release also implicitly supports governance by describing the deployment of a specific AI tool for a defined business process within D.R. Horton.
relevant_sources.title: D.R. Horton taps Prophetic AI to build more homes

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: Documentation describes the components (ZoneAI and SiteAI) and specific functions of an AI-native platform, including its role in extracting zoning rules, environmental data, and parcel records. It also details the capabilities of Prophetic's AI, referencing its use of a large language model for automated zoning analysis and its ability to process zoning documents across multiple jurisdictions.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. Transparency is supported by the detailed description of the AI-native platform's components (ZoneAI and SiteAI) and its specific functions in extracting zoning rules, environmental data, and parcel records. Governance is implied by the organization-wide deployment of the platform to generate "go/no-go" acquisition decisions, indicating a structured approach to AI-driven decision-making and automated planning for business outcomes.
relevant_sources.title: Prophetic to Power D.R. Horton's AI-Driven Land Acquisition at National Scale

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency by detailing the capabilities of Prophetic's AI, including its use of a large language model for automated zoning analysis and its ability to process zoning documents across multiple jurisdictions. The press release also implicitly supports governance by describing the deployment of a specific AI tool for a defined business process within D.R. Horton.
relevant_sources.title: D.R. Horton taps Prophetic AI to build more homes

summary.overall_findings: D.R. Horton's public disclosures describe the specific functions of its AI-native platform (ZoneAI and SiteAI) in extracting zoning rules, environmental data, and parcel records, addressing the transparency pillar. Published materials also reference the organization-wide deployment of an AI platform to generate "go/no-go" acquisition decisions, indicating a structured approach to AI-driven decision-making under governance, covering 2 of 7 evaluated pillars. Based on a review of 2 publicly available sources, no qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
